column2: OHIO DMV DRIVING TEST
column4: Ohio
column6: OH

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.
column4: white; black
column6: green; white
column8: yellow; black

column2: 2. A flashing yellow light:
column4: can be found before reaching a sharp curve.
column6: warns drivers to proceed with caution.
column8: is used at dangerous intersections.

column2: 3. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column4: yield to other pedestrians.
column6: finish crossing the street.
column8: go back and wait the “WALK” light

column2: 4. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a one lane bridge ahead.
column6: the right lane ends.
column8: drivers in the left lane have the right-of-way

column2: 5. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.
column6: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
column8: all vehicles must turn left immediately.

column2: 6. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.
column6: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column8: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.

column2: 7. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.
column6: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.
column8: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 8. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column4: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.
column6: Drivers should walk more and drive less.
column8: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.

column2: 9. Diamond-shaped signs:
column4: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.
column6: typically provide guidance to drivers.
column8: indicate no pass zones.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column4: Yield right-of-way to bicycles
column6: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles
column8: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: Pedestrian crossing ahead
column6: School zone ahead
column8: Pedestrians must not cross

column2: 12. This sign indicates:
column4: Double curve ahead
column6: Winding road
column8: Divided highway ends

column2: 13. This sign means:
column4: No traffic signal ahead
column6: The traffic signal is not operational
column8: Open intersection ahead

column2: 14. What does this sign indicate?
column4: Parallel railroad crossing (side road)
column6: Parallel railroad crossing (crossroad)
column8: Low ground clearance railroad crossing

column2: 15. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
column4: Railroad advance warning signs (round)
column6: Warning signs (diamond)
column8: Regulatory signs (vertical rectangle)

column2: 16. The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
column4: red; white
column6: yellow; black
column8: blue; white

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column4: Bicycle repair shop ahead
column6: Watch for bicycles
column8: No Bicycle zone

column2: 18. This sign indicates that:
column4: drivers may not turn right if traveling at 25 MPH or less.
column6: there is a school zone after the curve.
column8: the highest safe speed drivers should travel around the curve ahead is 25 MPH.
column10: the safe speed around the curve ahead is at least 25 MPH.

column2: 19. What is the meaning of red traffic signs?
column4: High emphasis warning.
column6: School ahead.
column8: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.

column2: 20. Which signs have black letters on a white background?
column4: Regulatory signs (vertical rectangle)
column6: Warning signs (diamond)
column8: Guide signs (horizontal rectangle)

column2: 21. When driving at night, you should slow down and:
column4: use high beams until other drivers dim their lights.
column6: use high beams whenever possible, but never when there's oncoming traffic.
column8: come to a complete stop whenever there's oncoming traffic.
column10: follow the vehicle ahead more closely to avoid glare from oncoming headlights.

column2: 22. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: remove yourself before it starts to sink.
column6: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.
column8: call the fire department immediately.

column2: 23. BAC is:
column4: the amount of alcohol in your body.
column6: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column8: the acronym for Beer ACcumulation.
column10: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 24. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
column4: Shift workers.
column6: Young people.
column8: Drivers who are driving alone.

column2: 25. What are some telltale signs of a drunk driver?
column4: Sudden stops.
column6: Driving slower than the normal flow of traffic.
column8: Weaving between lanes.

column2: 26. Anything that requires you to _______ could cause you to crash.
column4: take your eyes off the road
column6: take your hands off the wheel
column8: take your attention away from driving

column2: 27. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: make a U-turn and return to the expressway.
column6: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.
column8: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
column10: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.

column2: 28. A broken white line:
column4: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.
column6: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.
column8: marks the right edge of the roadway.

column2: 29. If your car starts to skid, turn your steering wheel:
column4: to keep the front wheels straight.
column6: in the opposite direction of the skid.
column8: in the direction you want to go.
column10: in any direction. It doesnt matter.

column2: 30. When driving on slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: increase their following distance.
column6: change lanes quickly.
column8: avoid crossing bridges or intersections.

column2: 31. Highway hypnosis is a driving condition that can result from:
column4: heavy traffic.
column6: travelling on HOV lanes.
column8: staring at the roadway for long periods of time.

column2: 32. Drivers should use the horn:
column4: when feeling angry or upset.
column6: only when necessary, to avoid collisions.
column8: if a driver is moving slowly, and you want them to drive faster.
column10: to alert other drivers that they made a mistake.

column2: 33. When two cars arrive at an intersection with no signs or signals at the same time, which car has the right-of-way?
column4: The car that is traveling faster.
column6: The car approaching from the right.
column8: The car in which the driver sounds the horn.
column10: The car approaching from the left.

column2: 34. When driving on major highways you should:
column4: keep your eyes moving.
column6: be ready to react to road hazards.
column8: stay alert.

column2: 35. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.
column6: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.
column8: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.

column2: 36. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.
column6: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.
column8: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.

column2: 37. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.
column6: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.
column8: the driver who was going faster before stopping must yield.
column10: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.

column2: 38. Your blind spot is the area of the road:
column4: you see in your side mirror.
column6: you see in your rearview mirror.
column8: you cannot see without moving your head.

column2: 39. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column4: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.
column6: Your eyes go out of focus by themselves.
column8: You continue to yawn.

column2: 40. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column4: increase your speed as you are probably driving too slowly.
column6: activate your stop lights.
column8: move to another lane if possible.
